refnamediv.refpurpose: Produces a signal that is the maximum of any number of input signals.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The max opcode takes any number of a-rate, k-rate or i-rate signals as input (all of the same rate), and outputs a signal at the same rate that is the maximum of all of the inputs. For a-rate signals, the inputs are compared one sample at a time (i.e. max does not scan an entire ksmps period of a signal for its local maximum as the max_k opcode does).

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: amax max ain1, ain2 [, ain3] [, ain4] [...]
kmax max kin1, kin2 [, kin3] [, kin4] [...]
imax max iin1, iin2 [, iin3] [, iin4] [...]

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: ain1, ain2, ... -- a-rate signals to be compared.
kin1, kin2, ... -- k-rate signals to be compared.
iin1, iin2, ... -- i-rate signals to be compared.
